title: 6 Easy Steps to Add Backlinks to Your Website

steps.title: You can do a Google search for high-quality backlinks, but never pay for links.
steps.content: You can do a Google search for high-quality backlinks, but never pay for links. You can go on related forums for more information on backlinks or read the Google Link Guidelines on what is required

steps.title: You'll need to create an account on each site you want to use.
steps.content: You'll need to create an account on each site you want to use. The registration or sign-up procedure is straightforward and will usually have an activation link sent to your email.

steps.title: Click the activation link in your email and sign in.
steps.content: Click the activation link in your email and sign in. You might have to create a password as well.

steps.title: Now that you are signed in, search for your profile button or control panel button (cp).
steps.content: Now that you are signed in, search for your profile button or control panel button (cp). Navigate to edit your profile. Keep in mind that each website or forum that will give you a backlink is different. In some cases, you add your URL address where indicated. In other cases, you also leave your URL address in the signature box. Still, in other cases, you leave your URL address in your bio section. It all depends and it is up to you to figure out, unless the backlinks have instructions.

steps.title: Add up to 3 links to your signature and bio boxes.
steps.content: Add up to 3 links to your signature and bio boxes. For example, keywords can be: Best Ways To Make Money Online, Make Money Online From Home, Best Home Based Business. These are 3 examples of keywords that will contain the link back to the website. However, recent changes to the Google Guidelines will suggest that you don't use anchor rich keywords and you will be much better off with just a 'Click Here' or URL link.

Depending on the site, you may need to use codes to create links. It will be indicated. Here is an example of the HTML code: KEYWORDS Here is the example of BBC code: [url=http://www.YOUR WEBSITE.com]KEYWORDS[/url]
